resources.string:
== HELP ==

This is the example application delivered with the hackrf_android library. Its intention is to demonstrate the functionality of the library and to provide running example code.

To use this App you need a HackRF connected to your device via an OTG USB cable. Press Open, give the App the permissions to open the USB device and hit Info to read out the Board ID, Version, Part ID and Serial Number from your device. RX will start receiving samples at the given sample rate and store them to a file on your SD card. If you leave the filename blank, all samples will go to /dev/null. With TX you can transmit a previously recorded file.

For more information on how to use hackrf_android in your own application see
http://tech.mantz-it.com/2014/10/hackrfandroid-using-hackrf-with-android.html

Get the latest version (binaries and sources) from the Github repository:
https://github.com/demantz/hackrf_android
